default-public.name: Global Fishing Activity
default-public.description: Monitor commercial fishing in near real-time from global AIS and VMS from our partner countries.

encounters-public.name: Vessel Encounters
encounters-public.description: Transhipment is one of the major missing links in understanding where illegally caught fish finds its way to the market.See more in Carrier Vessel Portal.

small-scale.name: Small Scale Fisheries
small-scale.description: Small-scale fisheries make an important contribution to nutrition, food security, sustainable livelihoods and poverty alleviation, especially in developing countries.

caribe-public.name: Caribbean
caribe-public.description: The Caribbean is a region of the Americas that consists of the Caribbean Sea, its islands and the surrounding coasts.

galapagos-public.name: Galapagos
galapagos-public.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Galapagos Marine Reserve is one of the most biologically diverse marine protected areas in the world.

tristan-public.name: Tristan da Cunha
tristan-public.description: Covering 690,000 square kilometers of ocean and home to critically endangered albatrosses, this marine protection zone is one of the largest in the world.

ascension-public.name: Ascension Island
ascension-public.description: At 440,000 square kilometers, this marine protected area covers 100 percent of Ascension’s exclusive economic zone and protects many native species like the Ascension Island Frigatebird.

palau-public.name: Palau
palau-public.description: Palau’s surrounding waters are home to remarkable fish and coral biodiversity, and includes the world’s first shark sanctuary.

chile.name: Chile
chile.description: Explore the Vessel Monitoring System (VMS) data provided by the Chilean government’s fisheries and aquaculture regulator, SERNAPESCA.

indonesia.name: Indonesia
indonesia.description: Explore the Vessel Monitoring System (VMS) data provided by the Indonesian Government’s Ministry of Maritime Affairs and Fisheries.
